events.originalText: A landslide triggered the collapse of a jade mine in Hpakant, Myanmar, resulting in six confirmed deaths and presumed dozens more.
events.subtitle: April 2019 Hpakant jade mine collapse
events.headline: Landslide in Hpakant, Myanmar kills 6 with dozens missing

events.originalText: A man intentionally struck pedestrians with a van on Yonge Street in Toronto, Canada, leading to 11 deaths.
events.subtitle: 2018 Toronto van attack
events.headline: Van attack on Yonge Street in Toronto leaves 11 dead

events.originalText: Arizona governor Jan Brewer signed into law the controversial anti–illegal immigration bill SB 1070, much of which was later struck down by the U.S. Supreme Court.
events.subtitle: Jan Brewer
events.headline: Arizona governor signs controversial anti-immigration bill SB 1070

events.originalText: Gamma-ray burst GRB 090423 was detected, coming from the most distant astronomical object of any kind known at the time.
events.subtitle: Gamma-ray burst
events.headline: Gamma-ray burst GRB 090423 detected from most distant object

events.originalText: Blair Peach, a British activist, was fatally injured after being knocked unconscious during an Anti-Nazi League demonstration in Southall, London, against a National Front election meeting.
events.subtitle: Death of Blair Peach
events.headline: British activist Blair Peach fatally injured in London demonstration

events.originalText: The Ramones released their eponymous debut album, which became highly influential on the emerging punk rock movement.
events.subtitle: Ramones
events.headline: The Ramones release influential debut album

events.originalText: The Rolling Stones released Sticky Fingers, the first album on their own label, Rolling Stones Records.
events.subtitle: The Rolling Stones
events.headline: The Rolling Stones release Sticky Fingers on new label

events.originalText: Batting for the Milwaukee Braves against Vic Raschi of the St. Louis Cardinals, Hank Aaron hit the first of his 755 home runs in Major League Baseball.
events.subtitle: Batting (baseball)
events.headline: Hank Aaron hits first of 755 home runs in MLB

events.originalText: American journalist William N. Oatis was arrested for espionage by the communist government of Czechoslovakia.
events.subtitle: William N. Oatis
events.headline: American journalist William N. Oatis arrested for espionage

events.originalText: World War II: The US Army's 90th Infantry Division liberated Flossenbürg concentration camp (pictured) in Germany, freeing 1,500 prisoners.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: US Army liberates Flossenbürg concentration camp in Germany

events.originalText: Second World War: In retaliation for the Royal Air Force's bombing of Lübeck, the Luftwaffe began a series of air raids across England, beginning with Exeter.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Luftwaffe retaliates with air raids on England after RAF bombing

events.originalText: Cardiff City defeated Arsenal 1–0 in the FA Cup Final (match programme pictured), the only time the FA Cup has been won by a non-English team.
events.subtitle: Cardiff City F.C.
events.headline: Cardiff City beats Arsenal 1-0 in FA Cup Final

events.originalText: The Grand National Assembly of Turkey, the country's unicameral legislature, first met in Ankara in the midst of the Turkish War of Independence.
events.subtitle: Grand National Assembly of Turkey
events.headline: Grand National Assembly of Turkey meets in Ankara during War of Independence

events.originalText: First World War: The British Royal Navy launched unsuccessful raids on Ostend and Zeebrugge in German-occupied Belgium.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: British Royal Navy launches unsuccessful raids in German-occupied Belgium

events.originalText: Chilean Civil War: The armored frigate Blanco Encalada was sunk at the Battle of Caldera Bay, the first ironclad warship lost to a self-propelled torpedo.
events.subtitle: Chilean Civil War of 1891
events.headline: Chilean Civil War: Blanco Encalada sunk at Battle of Caldera Bay

events.originalText: Charles II was crowned King of England, Scotland and Ireland at Westminster Abbey.
events.subtitle: Charles II of England
events.headline: Charles II crowned King of England, Scotland, and Ireland

events.originalText: Albanian commander Skanderbeg entered Krujë, breaking a 10-month siege by Ottoman forces.
events.subtitle: Skanderbeg
events.headline: Albanian commander Skanderbeg breaks siege of Krujë

events.originalText: Ottoman wars in Europe: Albanian leader Skanderbeg defeated an Ottoman army under Ballaban Badera to raise the siege of Krujë.
events.subtitle: Ottoman wars in Europe
events.headline: Skanderbeg defeats Ottoman army to raise siege of Krujë

events.originalText: The first appointments to the Order of the Garter, an order of chivalry founded by King Edward III of England, were announced.
events.subtitle: Order of the Garter
events.headline: First appointments to Order of the Garter announced
